trends: There have been 42 other sightings in Reading
There were no other sightings in Reading on or around October 7th 2008
Summary: I am still shaken about seeing a classic UFO in the sunset.It was there before me,and I can't get it out of my mind.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was leaving a local department store on a beautiful evening.When I reached my car,and opened the door,I glanced up at the gorgeous sunset.To the south I saw glowing copper in the glowing light a hovering object.Quiet as a cloud.Rather large it appeared cigar shaped at first with a strange protrusion in the nose.It was not a natural object,nor was it anything considered conventional.Oddly it was totally still.I keep watching,my eyes frozen in place.This must be a blimp,etc?No it was solid,and too flat.I was hoping for a witness,and I even wanted to run and get someone.A women approached her Toyoto Odyssey.Do you see what I do?"Yes "she said.Stood a moment at her vehicles door,than slipped in it,and left.Alone I continued to observe this thing just hanging there.Than the nose tilted slightly and it moved ever so slowly across the sky to the northeast.Dipping a bit,than leveling dipping abit,than leveling.As it silently mved Its shape beam more of a delta.I saw no lights,jets,roters,or engines of any kind.Its shape was flat in the year,with rounded edges.Shiny metallic veins still glowed copper or bronze in the sunlight.It disappered behind trees.Came out,than ducked behind them again til I could see it no longer.Why didn't I chase it?Why didn't I run into Rite Aide and get a disposable camera?Call the police?I am upset,and have recurring chills over this when I think of it.I don't drink,nor am I a UFO enthusiast or sci fi enthusiast.I am very well read though,and have a curious open and honest mind.I saw a classic UFO.I wish I could of taken a picture.This bothers me.I called the local airport and they said that there were not any unsual aircrft there or known in the area.Blimps ballons etc.This was very real.I relive it agan and again in my mind.
